Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the AKS cluster, including compute capacity, scalability, and workload types. Identify the applications and services that will run on the cluster.
Design the architecture for the AKS cluster, including node pools, VM sizes, and integration with existing Azure resources. Plan for high availability and scalability.
Secure approvals and authorizations for the AKS deployment, including budget, compliance, and security reviews.
Create the AKS cluster in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Configure node pools, VM sizes, and Kubernetes versions.
Set up networking for the AKS cluster, including virtual networks, subnets, and network security groups. Configure DNS and load balancers as needed.
Enable security features such as Azure Active Directory integration, RBAC, and pod security policies. Configure encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Deploy containerized applications to the AKS cluster using Kubernetes manifests or Helm charts. Ensure proper resource allocation and scaling configurations.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the AKS cluster using Azure Monitor and Container Insights. Configure alerts for node health, pod performance, and resource utilization.
Set up backup solutions for critical data and configurations. Plan and test disaster recovery procedures for the AKS cluster.
Perform thorough testing of the AKS cluster, including load testing, failover scenarios, and scalability tests to ensure it meets performance requirements.
Document the AKS cluster architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team for ongoing management.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the AKS cluster. Include best practices for Kubernetes management.
Conduct regular audits of the AKS cluster to ensure compliance with security and operational standards. Review configurations and access controls periodically.
